Sonatrach is very knowledgeable about the Spanish market and starting with Sonatrach and the other agents, nobody is going to do anything wild and there will be a build-up in met gas that will adopt to the Spanish market, or apply other gases that are currently coming in through Metanet.
So I think that we can rest assure regarding what's going happen with met gas, although as everyone will understand, I can't give any specific data
The next question is from Bruno Silva from BPI.

Good morning, everyone. And thank you for taking my questions. I have three questions. I think they're quick questions. The first is, can you tell us about the impact of the hedging with IBERDROLA RENOVABLES in Spain and the U.K. regarding the EBITDA of the liberalized business after nine months and whether there is any reference price in the U.K. for hedging in 2011?
The second question is, can you give us some more information on the impact on your estimated results for a full year after the changes in the regulation in the United States?

And the third question is related to the divestment issue. Can you give us an idea of what's in the pipeline regarding real estate assets and financial stakes? Could you give that some visibility? Are you planning to sell your stakes in regulated businesses in some countries, or are you going to do what you did in the U.S. and sell the whole Connecticut gas assets, for example, can you tell us something about that? And just a detail, I don't know whether you gave it, the impact of the social bonus, or premium, in Spain regarding the impact on costs?

Well, divestments – as I said, we manage the balance sheet in the most suitable way, properly. And the CFO said that in the next few days, you'll see some other divestments that are about to be concluded. And we'll do it in the same way we've done it in the past, which, well, we'll see.

We've divested in Connecticut, nobody expected it and we've done other things that nobody expected in Chile or elsewhere. And we'll see in the next few days another divestment that I think is also interesting.

The social bonus, well, we don't have the figures yet, we have to wait for the end of the year because the major impact comes at the end of the year with higher consumption and, as Paco said, in Spain, we're saying that there are 4 million customers under this bonus. And we have around over 1 million that we are currently supplying. It will be some tens of million of euros, but we'll have it in the results presentation at the end of the year. I'm sure that by then, we'll have these figures.

The regulatory changes in the United States, well, we haven't worked out the budget for next year, but we have a framework, as I said, which is much more favorable than it was. The new regulatory framework is only going to cover one quarter. The ROE is higher, as well as all the efficiencies that we will achieve over the next four years. That will be shared out between the company and the consumers.

And we're working very seriously right now to maximize those efficiencies, because that is what is going to substantially improve that nominal ROE. How much next year? Well, again, it's still in the kitchen. But in the next few years, we think that there is going to be a substantial growth. We're going to go from less to more. The efficiency improvements, the base is the same. The base is the same one we have now, but with an improved debt equity ratio and therefore, that gives us more earnings because of that. And then as we gain inefficiency, well, we'll see that progressively from here to 2014.
Regarding the impact of hedging with RENOVABLES, Paco, you can comment on this.

The contract with RENOVABLES is a beneficial contract for both sides. It's a long-term contract where both sides benefit. So it doesn't make sense to analyze the specific impact of a few months. And when you look at a few specific months in the year, since it's been thought for the long-term, the figures wouldn't be representative.

I think that the price at which that contract we signed was a price that was included in the communication given to the stock exchange commission. And I think it's very much inline with the wholesale market right now. So without working out the figures, the exact figures, as the questioner realizes, I think that it's a draw. Neither one of the side wins.

Yes, I think that's right. The latest figures, I think that the figure was exactly the same. And seeing how prices are going to evolve a year and a half in advance, there's a lot in favor of you and your team, guessing what the market price is going to be. And you got it right. I can't remember what the price was, but it certainly was a published price, 46, 47 years, I can't remember the figure, but yes, the figures are exactly the actual figures now.

Well, one hour and fifty minutes have gone by since we started the presentation. We know that there are still questions, but we have to finish. And from the Department of Relations with the investors will be answering your questions. So Ignacio, whenever you want.
Well, thank you very much and I only hope and trust that as I said before, that the end of this year results will maintain or improve our performance of the last nine months.
So thank you very much for your support. And I hope to see you again at the beginning of the year. Thank you very much. Good bye.
